;

;After the integration of coal resources in Shanxi began in 2009, Jinhai Coal Mine was retained separately, and the market price soared to tens of billions of yuan. Visual China/Picture

;

;The Shanxi “Ten Billion Mine Contest Case” that once shocked the legal community has taken a major turn.

;

;17 years ago, Zhang Xinming, the former richest man in Shanxi and chairman of Jinye Group, and his related parties transferred their shares in Jinhai Coal Mine to the state-owned Shanxi Coal Transportation and Marketing Group Jincheng Yangcheng Co., Ltd. in order to alleviate their financial difficulties. (hereinafter referred to as Yangcheng Coal Transportation) and Qinhe Investment Co., Ltd. (hereinafter referred to as Qinhe Investment) headed by Lu Zhonglou.

;

;However, as the Shanxi coal industry began to merge and reorganize in 2009, the value of Jinhai coal mine soared sharply. Zhang Xinming began to launch a series of lawsuits against Yangcheng Coal Transportation, Qinhe Investment and its chairman Lu Zhonglou. When the plaintiff transferred the equity to the defendant, the price was too low. Zhang Xinming won all these lawsuits.

;

;Jinhai Coal Mine is located in Yangcheng County, Jincheng City, Shanxi Province. The coalfield area is about 53.7 square kilometers and the total resource reserves are 409 million tons. It is extremely rare in Shanxi, where coal mines are everywhere.

;

;The verdicts of this series of cases have caused huge controversy, and the fates of two coal tycoons, Zhang Xinming and Lu Zhonglou, have also taken different paths.

;

;Zhang Xinming is known as the "Minister of Shanxi Underground Organization". In August 2014, Zhang Xinming was taken away by the public security organs in Taiyuan, and there has been no news since. Shanxi's officialdom also experienced constant earthquakes, and officials were dismissed one after another.

;

;Recently, three of the above-mentioned series of lawsuits were heard by the Supreme People's Court of the People's Republic of China (hereinafter referred to as the Supreme Court) and the Shanxi Provincial Higher People's Court (hereinafter referred to as the Shanxi Provincial High Court), and the original judgments were revoked. Another case upheld the original verdict. Zhang Xinming, who had "disappeared" for more than nine years, also returned to the stage due to the reopening of these cases.

;

;In June 2023, Yangcheng Coal Transportation and Zhang Xinming’s son Zhang Wenyang were retried over the equity dispute in Jinhai Coal Mine. Zhang Xinming appeared at the court hearing as his son’s litigation agent.

;

;Informed sources revealed to Southern Weekend reporters that Zhang Xinming will be released from prison on medical parole in mid-2020, and the relevant judgment will be kept confidential. In a photo in May 2020, 57-year-old Zhang Xinming was sitting in a wheelchair, dressed casually and looking relaxed.

;

;Based on the old and new judgments, a multi-party battle to grab the ore can be recreated.

;

;Ten-billion mining case and the sacking of the Vice President of the Supreme People’s Court

;

;In 2004, Zhang Xinming obtained the mining rights of Jinhai Coal Mine and established Shanxi Jinhai Energy Co., Ltd. (hereinafter referred to as Jinhai) Energy), with a registered capital of 30 million yuan. Except for obtaining the mining license of Jinhai Coal Mine on March 15 of that year, the company has not conducted other investments and operations.

;

;At that time, coal resources in Shanxi were still allocated administratively, and were either used free of charge by enterprises, or some symbolic resource fees were paid. This means that in a short period of time, those who obtain new mines can make huge profits.

;

;The mineral resource fee of Jinhai Coal Mine totals 224 million yuan (0.55 yuan/ton), which is paid in six years. In May 2004, Jinhai Energy paid the first installment of 37.3849 million yuan.

;

;In 2005, Jinhai Energy was short of funds and began to introduce external investors. At that time, Zhang Xinming and his related natural persons held 60% of the shares in Jinhai Energy, and Beijing Xinye Investment Co., Ltd. (hereinafter referred to as Beijing Xinye) held 40% of the shares.

;

;Of the above 60% shares;, Zhang Xinming holds 17%, his son Zhang Wenyang holds 40%, Feng Xiaolin holds 2%, and Wang Xiangdong holds 1%. ;Zhang Wenyang and Feng Xiaolin once stated during the trial that they were both acting on behalf of Zhang Xinming.

;

;"Finance" magazine once reported that Wang Xiangdong is the son of a former main leader of the Shanxi Provincial Party Committee. People familiar with the case also confirmed this to Southern Weekend reporters.

;

;The original executive director and legal representative of Beijing Xinye is the mysterious Shanxi businessman Yan Qi. According to Caijing magazine, Yan Qi was originally a student of the Shanxi Provincial Department of Materials and Materials, and later founded Shanxi Yunchang Real Estate Company. He has never been involved in coal mining during his career.

;

;Yan Qi later founded Sanya Luhuitou Tourist Area Development Co., Ltd. and developed the famous villa market "Banshan Peninsula". Its subsidiaries also include Sanya Aidi Real Estate Company and Hong Kong Tianfu Company. ;In 2015, Yan Qi ranked as the richest man in Hainan on the Hurun Rich List with assets of 9 billion yuan. ;

;

;In December 2005, Jinhai Energy and Yangcheng Coal Transportation signed an equity transfer agreement. Zhang Wenyang and Beijing Xinye transferred 13% and 15% of their equity respectively, and Yangcheng Coal Transportation paid for these equity A transfer price of 8.4 million yuan was obtained, which is equivalent to 300,000 yuan per share, which is the same as the registered capital price per share.

;

;At the same time, Yangcheng Coal Transportation provided entrusted loans of 280 million yuan each to the Yuefeng Coal Washing Plant under Beijing Xinye and Jinye Group (Zhang Xinming is the chairman), with a term of 6 years, and the interest is based on bank deposit interest rates for the same period. calculate. After obtaining 28% of the equity of Jinhai Coal Mine, Yangcheng Coal Transportation paid another 74.76 million yuan in resource price, and Jinhai Energy’s mining rights were extended.

;

;In 2007, Jinhai Energy also acquired Qinhe Investment from Lu Zhonglou as a shareholder. In September of that year, six shareholders of Jinhai Energy signed an equity transfer agreement with Qinhe Investment. Zhang Xinming, Zhang Wenyang, Feng Xiaolin, and Beijing Xinye transferred 17%, 27%, 2%, and 15% of their equity respectively to Qinhe Investment. The latter paid an equity transfer fee of 18.3 million yuan, which is also 300,000 yuan per share.

;

;At the same time, Qinhe Investment also provided a 5-year interest-free loan of 375 million yuan to Beijing Xinye, and signed a loan agreement with Zhang Xinming.

;

;After Beijing Xinye transferred its equity to Qinhe Investment, the two parties signed a supplementary agreement to change the transfer price of 15% of Beijing Xinye’s equity from 4.5 million yuan to 200 million yuan. It was previously agreed that The 375 million yuan loan lapsed.

;

;In 2009, 1% of Wang Xiangdong’s equity was transferred to Qinhe Investment for 300,000 yuan. At this point, the shareholders of Jinhai Energy have become Qinhe Investment, Yangcheng Coal Transportation and Beijing Xinye, with each of the three parties holding 62%, 28% and 10% of the shares.

;

;At this time, Shanxi coal resources began to merge and reorganize, but Jinhai Coal Mine was retained alone, and the market price soared to tens of billions of yuan. According to the above report, in the first half of 2009, Zhang Xinming repeatedly persuaded Lu Zhonglou to sell 62% of the Jinhai Coal Mine equity for 900 million yuan, but Lu disagreed.

;

;After that, Zhang Xinming began to sue Qinhe Investment and requested to terminate the equity transfer agreement on the grounds that the value of each equity share of Jinhai Coal Mine was much greater than 300,000 yuan. The lawsuit went all the way to the Supreme Court.

;

;;The Supreme Court quoted the supplementary agreement between Beijing Xinye and Qinhe Investment, a non-party in the case, and considered that the transfer price of 15% of Jinhai Energy held by Beijing Xinye was changed to 200 million yuan, and held that Qinhe Investment changed from Zhang The market value of the 46%;; equity transferred by Xinming Division should exceed; 600 million yuan. The amount paid by Qinhe Investment was "significantly lower than the market value of the equity involved in the case", and accordingly the original trial was upheld. The court supported Zhang Xinming’s request to terminate the contract, transfer Qin and return the equity.

;

;The case was judged in September 2012, and the case number was "(2011) Minerzhongzi No. 76", also known as "Judgment No. 76".

;

;This verdict caused huge controversy.

;

;In January 2013, two seminars on the "Judgment No. 76" were held in Beijing. More than 30 civil and commercial law scholars, including jurist Jiang Ping, professor of the Chinese Academy of Social Sciences Liang Huixing, and professor of China University of Political Science and Law Li Shuguang, attended discuss.

;

;Liang Huixing said at the above-mentioned seminar that if coal prices did not rise, there would be no case. He believes that "the Supreme Court made a judgment based on the principle of fairness, which is wrong." Since both parties are businessmen, the agreement between the two parties is fair. As long as it does not violate the law or harm the interests of the country and society, the court has no power to intervene. .

;

;The then Vice President of the Supreme People's Court;Xi Xiaoming also compiled the case into the book "Supreme People's Court Commercial Trial Guidance Cases (2012) Company and Finance";. In July 2015, Xi Xiaoming was investigated for suspected serious violations of discipline and law, and was eventually accused of accepting a huge financial bribe of 114 million yuan.

;

;According to "Caixin" reports, Zhang Xinming paid 30 million yuan in bribes to Xi Xiaoming through a broker, of which 18 million yuan was given to Xi Xiaoming's son Xi Jiacheng, and the remaining 12 million yuan belonged to Xi Xiaoming.

;

;"Judgment No. 76" is the final judgment of the Supreme People's Court. If you are not satisfied with the judgment, Qinhe Investment can also apply for a protest to the Supreme People's Procuratorate. Lu Zhonglou told Southern Weekend reporters that Qinhe Investment is preparing to apply for a protest.

;

;In addition to the "Judgment No. 76", from 2010 to 2012, related parties such as Yangcheng Coal Transportation, Qinhe Investment and Lu Zhonglou were also sued by Zhang Xinming and his associates, Beijing Xinye The lawsuit was filed, all demanding that the Jinhai Coal Mine Equity Transfer Agreement be terminated and that all parties return their equity.

;

;Among them, there are 4 cases that were retried this time.

;

;Restart

;

;Another person close to the Jinhai Coal Mine Equity Dispute case told Southern Weekend reporters that there has been no movement in this series of lawsuits for 10 years. He suddenly got the lawsuit at the end of 2022. It is known that the case will be restarted. After the spring of 2023, the pace of the trial will gradually slow down and return to a normal pace.

;

;In October 2023, Yangcheng Coal Transportation received two final judgments one after another, from the Supreme People's Court and the Shanxi Provincial High Court, and the signing dates were September 7 and September 18, 2023 respectively. The original judgments were all revoked.

;

;In 2011 and 2012, Zhang Wenyang and Beijing Xinye sued Yangcheng Coal Transportation to court. They argued that the 28% equity transferred by Jinhai Energy to Yangcheng Coal Transportation included a loan principal of 560 million yuan. , please rule that the equity transfer agreement between the two parties is invalid and return the equity.

;

;;The Shanxi Provincial High Court and Shanxi Jincheng Intermediate Court, the original courts of the two cases, both cited "Judgment No. 76" and held that Jinhai Energy's "transfer price of 300,000 yuan per share was not between the parties to the agreement." True meaning ;;", ; thereby supporting Zhang Wenyang and Beijing Xinye. Yangcheng Coal Transport was dissatisfied and appealed to the Supreme Court and Shanxi Provincial High Court respectively. Since then, there has been no progress in the two cases.

;

;;The Supreme People’s Court and the Shanxi Provincial High Court, which were responsible for the final review this time, believed that the entire transfer consideration of the 28% stake in Jinhai Energy involved included both the 8.4 million yuan clearly agreed in the transfer agreement and Zhang Xinming’s Fang used the business interests of 560 million yuan for 6 years through entrusted loans at low interest rates. Therefore, the original judgment was revoked and the validity of the equity transfer agreement was recognized. ;

;

;“The core requirement of the market economy legal system is the protection of property rights. These two judgments demonstrate the Supreme Court’s respect for the order of market transactions and the expression of the will of market entities.” Yangcheng Coal Transportation Lawyer Hu Xiaoyong told Southern Weekend reporters. He has taken over the equity dispute between Yangcheng Coal Transportation and Zhang Xinmingfang since 2012.

;

;“Commercial interests can be understood as opportunity value.” Hu Xiaoyong explained that Zhang Xinming obtained the opportunity value of using hundreds of millions of yuan of funds at low interest rates for 6 years, and then used it to invest in other real estate projects, thereby obtaining huge commercial interests. . These commercial interests together constitute the equity transfer price.

;

;;On September 18, 2023;, the Supreme People’s Court also made a final judgment on Beijing Xinye’s lawsuit against Qinhe Investment, revoking the original judgment and supporting some of Qinhe Investment’s requests.

;

;;In 2011;, Beijing Xinye sued Qinhe Investment, saying that the two parties agreed that Qinhe Investment would transfer 15% of the equity transfer money to Beijing Xinye in the form of a loan, totaling 375 million yuan, 25 million yuan per share. ;Beijing Xinye changed the equity information to the name of Qinhe Investment as promised; Qinhe Investment only paid 200 million yuan, leaving 175 million yuan unpaid.

;

;Beijing Xinye believed that Qinhe Investment constituted a fundamental breach of contract, and requested the first instance judgment to terminate the equity transfer agreement and the loan agreement between the two parties, and to allow the latter to return the equity.

;

;During the trial of the case, Yan Qi, the legal representative of Beijing Xinye, denied that he had signed a supplementary agreement with Qinhe Investment, that is, the equity transfer amount was changed from 4.5 million yuan to 200 million yuan, and also reported to the police that he had signed a supplementary agreement with Qinhe Investment. The agreement was "forged."

;

;The first-instance judgment of the Shanxi Provincial High Court also quoted "Judgment No. 76" and stated that "Judgment No. 76" and the 15% shares involved in the above-mentioned case "were based on the same background, at the same shareholder meeting, at the same time." , changed at the same time with the same price per share", it is believed that "the equity transfer price of 300,000 yuan per share is obviously low." In the end, it was ruled that the agreement was invalid and Qinhe Investment returned its equity.

;

;Qinhe Investment was dissatisfied with the above-mentioned first-instance judgment and appealed to the Supreme Court. On May 29, 2013, the Supreme People's Court formed a collegial panel to hear the case, but nothing happened. In January 2023, the Supreme People’s Court heard the case again after the change of the collegial bench.

;

;This time, the Supreme People’s Court accepted the supplementary agreement and determined that Qinhe Investment should pay Beijing Xinye the equity transfer price of 200 million yuan. It was finally recognized that Qinhe Investment had paid 147.265 million yuan for the equity transfer, corresponding to all 11.044875% of the equity, and the court ordered Qinhe Investment to return the remaining 3.955125% equity to Beijing Xinye.

;

;“Basically fair.” Ji Jingwu, attorney for Qinhe Investment, told Southern Weekend reporters, but the judgment is still unsatisfactory. In his view, Beijing Xinye had admitted in the first instance that Qinhe Investment had paid 200 million yuan for the equity transfer, so Qinhe Investment no longer needed to prove this.

;

;On this basis, Ji Jingwu believed that ; Beijing Xinye’s lawsuit on the grounds that Qinhe Investment failed to perform the loan agreement cannot be established, and the court should dismiss Beijing Xinye’s lawsuit in accordance with the law. The current judgment results in changing its litigation claims.

;

;"Empty the cage and change the bird"

;

;There is still one retrial to uphold the original verdict, which is also the earliest verdict among the four retrial cases.

;

;On March 12, 2009, Wang Xiangdong, a shareholder of Jinhai Energy, signed a letter of authorization entrusting Yan Qi to handle the transfer of Jinhai Energy's equity interests. Yan Qi has served as the legal representative of Beijing Xinye and Jinhai Energy.

;

;On April 9 of that year, Yan Qi signed an equity transfer agreement with Qinhe Investment on behalf of Wang Xiangdong, stipulating that Wang Xiangdong would transfer 1% of the equity he held to Qinhe Investment for a price of 300,000 yuan.

;

;In November 2011, Wang Xiangdong took Qinhe Investment to court. The reason was that the equity transfer price was too low. Please terminate the transfer agreement and return the equity. The case went through two trials, and the Shanxi Provincial High Court of the second instance upheld the original verdict on September 27, 2012, supporting Wang Xiangdong.

;

;Wang Xiangdong acknowledged the authenticity of the power of attorney during the trial, but said he had no knowledge of the equity transfer and did not agree to transfer equity worth more than 20 million yuan with a registered capital value of 300,000 yuan. transfer.

;

;Both courts of both instances held that the equity transfer price of 300,000 yuan was significantly lower than the transfer price that Yan Qi and Qinhe Investment knew of, and both parties transferred Wang Xiangdong’s equity at an obviously too low price without Wang Xiangdong’s consent. equity, harming its interests, and the behavior of Yan Qi and Qinhe Investment constituted malicious collusion. Qinhe Investment was dissatisfied and applied to the Supreme Court for retrial.

;

;The main basis for the court of first instance to judge that Yan Qi knew that the equity transfer price was too low was the supplementary agreement signed between Beijing Xinye and Qinhe Investment.

;

;On April 28, 2023, the Supreme People’s Court made a final judgment on the case, still based on the supplementary agreement, and determined that 1% of Jinhai Energy’s equity would exceed 13 million yuan. Yan Qi and Qinhe Investment jointly Wang Xiangdong's rights and interests were damaged and the original verdict was upheld.

;

;In Ji Jingwu’s view, the case between Wang Xiangdong and Qinhe Investment is the simplest in the series of lawsuits over Jinhai Coal Mine equity disputes. “Does such a simple case need to be tried for 10 years?”

; < p>; He believes that Wang Xiangdong entrusted Yan Qi with full authority to handle the equity transfer, so the equity transfer agreement signed by Yan Qi on behalf of Wang Xiangdong and Qinhe Investment did not exceed the agency authority.

;

;In addition, before the judgment of this case, the authenticity of the supplementary agreement had not been recognized by any court. Secondly, even if the agreement is genuine, the court determined that the equity transfer price in this case was low and unreasonable based on an agreement between a party outside the case.

;

;I wonder if the disputes between shareholders can stop here.

;

;At present, after reexamination, the equity structure of Jinhai Energy has become: Zhang Xinmingfang 46%, Yangcheng Coal Transportation 28%, Beijing Xinye 13.955125%, Qinhe Investment 11.044875%, and Wang Xiangdong 1%.

;

;The Jinhai Coal Mine, which was supposed to shine, has been in a state of stagnation over the years.

;

;The 2021 coal mine classification list released by the Office of the Work Safety Committee of the Shanxi Provincial People's Government shows that Jinhai Coal Mine is a Class D coal mine, that is, a coal mine that has been suspended for a long time.

;

;However, Jinhai Coal Mine may have new progress.

;

;In March 2021, Jinhai Coal Mine appeared in the list of the first batch of projects released by Shanxi Provincial state-owned enterprises in 2021. The provincial state-owned enterprise is Jinneng Holding Group Co., Ltd. (hereinafter referred to as Jinneng Group).

;

;; "Empty the cage and replace the bird" is a key measure in the reform of Shanxi state-owned enterprises, which specifically includes disposing of inefficient and ineffective assets to effectively revitalize accumulated funds; selling part of the equity to recover cash while introducing various types of capital to achieve equity diversification; obtain funds by selling part of the shares of listed companies, optimize the equity structure of listed companies, etc. ;

;

;The reason why Jinhai Coal Mine is under the responsibility of Jinneng Group may be because Jinneng Group controls Yangcheng Coal Transportation.

;

;On June 20, 2022, the Yangcheng County People's Government Office issued the "Notice on the Establishment of the Yangcheng Daning Jinhai Coal Mine Project Construction Leading Group". The notice stated that the Jinhai Coal Mine plans to officially start construction in the fourth quarter of 2022 , the construction period is two years.
